content: The report analyzes forest management provisions enacted in the 115th Congress through two legislative vehicles, the FY2018 omnibus and the 2018 farm bill. These provisions address forest management on federal lands, federal programs for nonfederal lands, and forestry research. The focus is on changes to Forest Service and Bureau of Land Management operations. This report analyzes forest management provisions enacted in the 115th Congress, focusing on changes to how the Forest Service (FS) and Bureau of Land Management (BLM) manage their lands. FS manages 193 million acres of the National Forest System (NFS), while BLM oversees 246 million acres of public lands. The provisions affect project planning, implementation, and procedural requirements for forest management activities. The report summarizes and analyzes forest management provisions enacted in the 115th Congress, focusing on project planning, wildland fire management, forest management and restoration programs, and miscellaneous issues. It discusses changes made in Congress, potential issues, and compares provisions to prior laws.
